title: Optional integration with c2isl
body_html:
• We add c2isl as an optional dependency. The recommended
    installation procedure is Conda; we'll pick up c2isl installs
    in $CONDA_PREFIX and use them if available.

  • This commit set adds conversion functions between ATen tensors
    and dlpack. The place they currently live is not long-term
    where we should put them, but as ATen does not presently have
    a dependency on the dlpack headers there isn't really anywhere
    we can put them at the moment.

  • The code for dispatching to c2isl was heavily based off of
    the existing code for handling Caffe2. We have a proof of
    concept operator using c2isl's MatMul implementation; gradient
    is NOT supported, and you must instantiate a new ISLMatMul class
    every time you want to run it on a different size. You won't
    really get any performance increase this way, but this at least
    demonstrates it is possible to call to c2isl.

  • In order to interface with c2isl, we have to allocate C-style
    DLTensor structures. The memory management involved here is
    somewhat delicate and we have some custom deleters to handle
    the situation.

- We add c2isl as an optional dependency.  The recommended
  installation procedure is Conda; we'll pick up c2isl installs
  in $CONDA_PREFIX and use them if available.

- This commit set adds conversion functions between ATen tensors
  and dlpack.  The place they currently live is not long-term
  where we should put them, but as ATen does not presently have
  a dependency on the dlpack headers there isn't really anywhere
  we can put them at the moment.

- The code for dispatching to c2isl was heavily based off of
  the existing code for handling Caffe2.  We have a proof of
  concept operator using c2isl's MatMul implementation; gradient
  is NOT supported, and you must instantiate a new ISLMatMul class
  every time you want to run it on a different size.  You won't
  really get any performance increase this way, but this at least

- In order to interface with c2isl, we have to allocate C-style
